intro: Schoenocaulon texanum, commonly known as Texas star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its compact, low-growing form. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped white flowers during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it thrives in well-drained soils. It is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
